desc: Students examine freshwater ecology related to pollution in freshwater resources, including streams, lakes, wetlands and groundwater. Global patterns of water distribution and use are examined from a management perspective. Using case studies, students examine the effects of water use on water quality. Topics vary year to year but may include wastewater treatment, wetland restoration, sedimentation and effects of dams. Offered during Interim. Prerequisites: Biology 125 and 126.
name: Water Resource Mgmt
notes: Open to first-year students with permission of instructor.
title: Water Resource Management
